text: The 1950 Arizona State Sun Devils football team was an American football team that represented Arizona State College (later renamed Arizona State University) in the Border Conference during the 1950 college football season. In their fourth season under head coach Ed Doherty, the Sun Devils compiled a 9–1 record (4–1 against Border opponents), lost to Miami (OH) in the Salad Bowl, and outscored their opponents by a combined total of 404 to 154. ==References== Arizona State Category:Arizona State Sun Devils football seasons Category:1950 in sports in Arizona
title: 1950 Arizona State Sun Devils football team
